prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through the evidence and testimonies one by one to understand what's going on.

First, looking at the evidence, I see that Evidence 12 is the Crime Photo. It describes the scene taken from near the kitchen, showing two dining tables separated by a folding screen. One table is empty, and the other has the victim collapsed on it. There's an intact vase on each table, a coffee cup knocked over, and some papers near the coffee table. Importantly, no one is sitting across from the victim.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 0 from Jean Armstrong says that the mirror was in the middle of the restaurant, dividing the two halves. Testimony 1 mentions that there's only one seat from which you could have seen the victim. Testimony 2 says that seat was where the old man was sitting. Testimony 3 states that after the incident, Armstrong moved the mirror so it wasn't in the way. Testimony 4 claims he didn't touch anything else.

The contradiction here seems to be between the Crime Photo (Evidence 12) and Testimony 3. The photo shows that the mirror was present at the crime scene, but Armstrong claims he moved it. If the mirror was moved, it shouldn't appear in the photo taken right after the crime. However, the photo clearly shows the mirror in place, which contradicts Armstrong's testimony that he moved it.
</think>

Testimony 0
Testimony: La victim, Monsieur Elg, 'e came to my restaurant alone.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: I remember la old man arrived not long after 'im, just after 2 PM.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: Z'ere were no other customers.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: When 'e got word 'e won la lottery, Mon. Elg became very excited.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was approximately 5 minutes later z'at la poisoning incident occurred.

Testimony 6

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's go through the evidence and testimonies step by step.

First, looking at the evidence, I see that Evidence 10, Glen's Autopsy Report, states that the time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM. This is crucial because it sets the timeframe for when the murder occurred.

Now, examining the testimonies, Testimony 2 from Jean Armstrong says that the old man arrived not long after Glen Elg, just after 2 PM. This places the arrival of the old man around 2 PM.

If the victim died between 1:30 and 2:30 PM, and the old man arrived just after 2 PM, there's a possibility that the old man was present during the time of the murder. However, Testimony 3 from Armstrong claims that there were no other customers, which would mean that the old man wasn't there at the time of the incident.

This creates a contradiction because if the old man arrived just after 2 PM, which is within the timeframe of the murder, but Armstrong claims there were no other customers, it suggests that the old man might have been involved in the crime despite his testimony.

Therefore, the evidence (Glen's Autopsy Report) and the testimony (Armstrong's statement about no other customers) contradict each other because the timeline suggests the old man was present during the murder, but Armstrong claims no other customers were there.
</think>

Testimony 0
Testimony: I don't know nothin' about no murder.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 1
Testimony: I was tied up with business in December last year. Spent all'a my time in my office.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 2
Testimony: The day youse talkin' about, I was in de office, too. I never saw that kid before.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 3
Testimony: I got whales lined up to borrow cash from Tender Lender every single day.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 4
Testimony: Youse wanna check my alibi, just ask Violetta.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, looking at the evidence list, I see several items. One of them is Evidence 20, which is Glen's Calendar. It mentions that on December 3rd, there's a note saying "Meet with The Tiger." The Tiger is Furio Tigre, the head of Tender Lender. So, this suggests that Glen had a meeting scheduled with Tigre on the day of the incident.

Now, looking at the testimonies, there's one from Furio Tigre. In his testimony, Tigre claims that he was in his office the entire day and didn't see Glen Elg. He also says that he was busy with business and had many clients, so he couldn't have been involved.

Putting this together, Evidence 20 shows that Glen had a scheduled meeting with Tigre on the day of the incident. However, Tigre's testimony says he was in his office and didn't meet with Glen. This creates a contradiction because if Glen's calendar shows a meeting with Tigre, but Tigre denies meeting him, there's a conflict in the timelines or alibis.

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 20 (Glen's Calendar) and Tigre's testimony, specifically Testimony 3 where he says he was in his office all day and never saw Glen. This suggests that Tigre's alibi might be false if he indeed had a meeting with Glen as per the calendar.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. 

First, I'll look at the evidence and testimonies provided. The evidence is numbered from 0 to 27, and the testimonies are from 0 to 4. 

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar, which shows that on December 3rd, the day of the incident, there's a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger." The Tiger is Furio Tigre, the head of Tender Lender. 

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 2 from Furio Tigre says he set up a meeting with Glen Elg at his office, Tender Lender, but Glen never showed up. 

Wait, but according to the calendar, Glen had a note to meet with The Tiger. So if the calendar shows he planned to meet Tigre, but Tigre says Glen never showed up, there's a contradiction here. 

So, the evidence (Glen's Calendar) suggests Glen intended to meet Tigre, while Tigre's testimony claims Glen didn't show up. This means they contradict each other. 

Therefore, the contradicting pair is Evidence 20 and Testimony 2.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through the evidence and testimonies carefully.

First, looking at the evidence, Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar, which shows that on December 3rd, there's a note saying "Meet with The Tiger." That suggests Glen had plans to meet Furio Tigre on the day of the incident.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 2 from Tigre says that when he opened the door to the restaurant, he saw Glen laid out over the table, stiff as concrete. This implies that Tigre was at the scene of the crime and saw Glen after he was already dead.

But wait, according to the calendar (Evidence 20), Glen was supposed to meet Tigre at the restaurant. If Tigre was at the restaurant and saw Glen dead, that would mean he was there around the time of the crime. However, if the calendar shows a planned meeting, it's possible that Tigre's testimony about being at the scene might conflict with the planned meeting time or his alibi.

So, the contradiction arises because if Tigre was supposed to meet Glen at the restaurant, his presence there could mean he had the opportunity to commit the crime, which might conflict with his testimony claiming he just saw the scene after it happened.

Therefore, the evidence (Glen's Calendar) and Tigre's testimony about being at the crime scene contradict each other because the calendar suggests a planned meeting, which might imply Tigre was involved, while his testimony claims he was just a witness.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's break it down step by step.

First, I'll look at the evidence provided. Evidence 3 is the Sports Paper, which has a doodle by the victim, Glen Elg, indicating a plan to steal $100,000. This suggests Glen was involved in some sort of scheme. On the other hand, Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar, which shows a meeting with Furio Tigre on the day of the incident.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Tigre claims he loaned Glen $100,000 and that the meeting was about repayment. He also says the victim was lucky to win the lottery, which led to the poisoning incident.

Wait, there's a contradiction here. If the calendar shows a meeting with Tigre, it implies Glen was supposed to meet him, possibly about the loan. But the Sports Paper shows Glen planning to steal $100,000, which might mean he intended to repay the loan through illegal means. Tigre's testimony about the loan and the meeting doesn't align with Glen's doodle indicating a plan to steal, suggesting a possible setup or misunderstanding.

So, the evidence from the Sports Paper (Evidence 3) contradicts Tigre's testimony about the loan and the meeting, as it implies Glen was planning something else entirely.
</think>
